CVE-2008-0005.title: Apache: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-19
CVE-2008-0005.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache.
CVE-2008-0005.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2008-0005.body: Adrian Pastor and Amir Azam (ProCheckUp) reported that the HTTP Method specifier header is not properly sanitized when the HTTP return code is "413 Request Entity too large" (CVE-2007-6203). The mod_proxy_balancer module does not properly check the balancer name before using it (CVE-2007-6422). The mod_proxy_ftp does not define a charset in its answers (CVE-2008-0005). Stefano Di Paola (Minded Security) reported that filenames are not properly sanitized within the mod_negotiation module (CVE-2008-0455, CVE-2008-0456).
CVE-2008-0005.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a malicious URL or send specially crafted HTTP requests (i.e using Adobe Flash) to perform Cross-Site Scripting and HTTP response splitting attacks, or conduct a Denial of Service attack on the vulnerable web server.

CVE-2008-0006.title: X.Org X server and Xfont library: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200801-09
CVE-2008-0006.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server and Xfont library, allowing for a local privilege escalation and arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2008-0006.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2008-0006.body: regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extension via iDefense:
CVE-2008-0006.extra: Remote attackers could exploit the vulnerability in the Xfont library by enticing a user to load a specially crafted PCF font file resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the X server, typically root. Local attackers could exploit this and the vulnerabilities in the X.org extensions to gain elevated privileges. If the X server allows connections from the network, these vulnerabilities could be exploited remotely. A local attacker could determine the existence of arbitrary files by exploiting the last vulnerability or possibly cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-0006.title: NX: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-05
CVE-2008-0006.subTitle: NX uses code from the X.org X11 server which is prone to multiple vulnerabilities.
CVE-2008-0006.background: NoMachine's NX establishes remote connections to X11 desktops over small bandwidth links. NX and NX Node are the compression core libraries, whereas NX is used by FreeNX and NX Node by the binary-only NX servers.
CVE-2008-0006.body: Multiple integer overflow and buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server as shipped by NX and NX Node (vulnerabilities 1-4 in GLSA 200801-09).
CVE-2008-0006.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities via unspecified vectors, leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user on the machine running the NX server.

CVE-2008-0008.title: Pulseaudio: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200802-07
CVE-2008-0008.subTitle: A vulnerability in pulseaudio may allow a local user to execute actions with escalated privileges.
CVE-2008-0008.background: Pulseaudio is a networked sound server with an advanced plugin system.
CVE-2008-0008.body: Marcus Meissner from SUSE reported that the pa_drop_root() function does not properly check the return value of the system calls setuid(), seteuid(), setresuid() and setreuid() when dropping its privileges.
CVE-2008-0008.extra: A local attacker could cause a resource exhaustion to make the system calls fail, which would cause Pulseaudio to run as root. The attacker could then perform actions with root privileges.

CVE-2008-0047.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-01
CVE-2008-0047.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-0047.background: CUPS provides a portable printing layer for UNIX-based operating systems.
CVE-2008-0047.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in CUPS:
CVE-2008-0047.extra: A local attacker could send specially crafted network packets or print jobs and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running CUPS (usually lp), or cause a Denial of Service. The vulnerabilities are exploitable via the network when CUPS is sharing printers remotely.

CVE-2008-0073.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2008-0073.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC:
CVE-2008-0073.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file or stream, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-0073.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200808-01
CVE-2008-0073.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing media streams.
CVE-2008-0073.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player, and other players such as Amarok, Codeine/Dragon Player and Kaffeine.
CVE-2008-0073.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in xine-lib:
CVE-2008-0073.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to play a specially crafted video file or stream with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-0162.title: SplitVT: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200803-05
CVE-2008-0162.subTitle: A vulnerability in SplitVT may allow local users to gain escalated privileges.
CVE-2008-0162.background: SplitVT is a program for splitting terminals into two shells.
CVE-2008-0162.body: Mike Ashton reported that SplitVT does not drop group privileges before executing the xprop utility.
CVE-2008-0162.extra: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain the "utmp" group privileges.

CVE-2008-0225.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200801-12
CVE-2008-0225.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple heap-based buffer overflows when processing RTSP streams.
CVE-2008-0225.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.
CVE-2008-0225.body: Luigi Auriemma reported that xine-lib does not properly check boundaries when processing SDP attributes of RTSP streams, leading to heap-based buffer overflows.
CVE-2008-0225.extra: An attacker could entice a user to play specially crafted RTSP video streams with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-0238.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200801-12
CVE-2008-0238.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple heap-based buffer overflows when processing RTSP streams.
CVE-2008-0238.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.
CVE-2008-0238.body: Luigi Auriemma reported that xine-lib does not properly check boundaries when processing SDP attributes of RTSP streams, leading to heap-based buffer overflows.
CVE-2008-0238.extra: An attacker could entice a user to play specially crafted RTSP video streams with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-0252.title: CherryPy: Directory traversal vulnerability — GLSA 200801-11
CVE-2008-0252.subTitle: CherryPy is vulnerable to a directory traversal that could allow attackers to read and write arbitrary files.
CVE-2008-0252.background: CherryPy is a Python-based, object-oriented web development framework.
CVE-2008-0252.body: CherryPy does not sanitize the session id, provided as a cookie value, in the FileSession._get_file_path() function before using it as part of the file name.
CVE-2008-0252.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to read and possibly write arbitrary files on the web server, or to hijack valid sessions, by providing a specially crafted session id. This only affects applications using file-based sessions.

CVE-2008-0314.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-19
CVE-2008-0314.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0314.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-0314.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised), or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-0318.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200802-09
CVE-2008-0318.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0318.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-0318.body: An integer overflow has been reported in the "cli_scanpe()" function in file libclamav/pe.c (CVE-2008-0318). Another unspecified vulnerability has been reported in file libclamav/mew.c (CVE-2008-0728).
CVE-2008-0318.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised).

CVE-2008-0320.title: OpenOffice.org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-16
CVE-2008-0320.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in OpenOffice.org, possibly allowing for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0320.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2008-0320.body: iDefense Labs reported multiple vulnerabilities in OpenOffice.org:
CVE-2008-0320.extra: Furthermore, Will Drewry (Google Security) reported vulnerabilities in the memory management of the International Components for Unicode (CVE-2007-4770, CVE-2007-4771), which was resolved with GLSA 200803-20. However, the binary version of OpenOffice.org uses an internal copy of said library.

CVE-2008-0386.title: Xdg-Utils: Arbitrary command execution — GLSA 200801-21
CVE-2008-0386.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in Xdg-Utils, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary commands.
CVE-2008-0386.background: Xdg-Utils is a set of tools allowing all applications to easily integrate with the Free Desktop configuration.
CVE-2008-0386.body: Miroslav Lichvar discovered that the "xdg-open" and "xdg-email" shell scripts do not properly sanitize their input before processing it.
CVE-2008-0386.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted link with a vulnerable application using Xdg-Utils (e.g. an email client), resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-0387.title: Firebird: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-02
CVE-2008-0387.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Firebird may allow the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0387.background: Firebird is a multi-platform, open source relational database.
CVE-2008-0387.body: Firebird does not properly handle certain types of XDR requests, resulting in an integer overflow (CVE-2008-0387). Furthermore, it is vulnerable to a buffer overflow when processing usernames (CVE-2008-0467).
CVE-2008-0387.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted XDR requests or an overly long username to the vulnerable server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-0486.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200802-12
CVE-2008-0486.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing FLAC and ASF streams.
CVE-2008-0486.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.
CVE-2008-0486.body: Damian Frizza and Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) discovered a stack-based buffer overflow within the open_flac_file() function in the file demux_flac.c when parsing tags within a FLAC file (CVE-2008-0486). A buffer overflow when parsing ASF headers, which is similar to CVE-2006-1664, has also been discovered (CVE-2008-1110).
CVE-2008-0486.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to play specially crafted FLAC or ASF video streams with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-0628.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2008-0628.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2008-0628.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2008-0628.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2008-0628.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2008-0668.subTitle: Several integer overflow vulnerabilities have been reported in Gnumeric, possibly resulting in user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-0668.background: The Gnumeric spreadsheet is a versatile application developed as part of the GNOME Office project.
CVE-2008-0668.body: Multiple integer overflow and signedness errors have been reported in the excel_read_HLINK() function in file plugins/excel/ms-excel-read.c when processing XLS HLINK opcodes.
CVE-2008-0668.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted XLS file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-0671.title: TinTin++: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201111-07
CVE-2008-0671.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in TinTin++ which could allow a remote attacker to conduct several attacks, including the execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-0671.background: TinTin++ is a free MUD gaming client.
CVE-2008-0671.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in TinTin++. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2008-0671.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers may be able to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the TinTin++ process, cause a Denial of Service, or truncate arbitrary files in the top level of the home directory belonging to the user running the TinTin++ process.

CVE-2008-0674.body: PCRE contains a buffer overflow vulnerability when processing a character class containing a very large number of characters with codepoints greater than 255.
CVE-2008-0674.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability by sending a specially crafted regular expression to an application making use of the PCRE library, which could possibly lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-0888.title: UnZip: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-06

CVE-2008-0888.background: Info-ZIP's UnZip is a tool to list and extract files inside PKZIP compressed files.
CVE-2008-0888.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered that the NEEDBITS macro in the inflate_dynamic() function in the file inflate.c can be invoked using invalid buffers, which can lead to a double free.
CVE-2008-0888.extra: Remote attackers could entice a user or automated system to open a specially crafted ZIP file that might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-0891.title: OpenSSL: Denial of service — GLSA 200806-08
CVE-2008-0891.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities might allow for a Denial of Service of daemons using OpenSSL.
CVE-2008-0891.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2008-0891.body: Ossi Herrala and Jukka Taimisto of Codenomicon discovered two vulnerabilities:
CVE-2008-0891.extra: A remote attacker could connect to a vulnerable server, or entice a daemon to connect to a malicious server, causing a Denial of Service of the daemon in both cases.

CVE-2008-0932.title: SWORD: Shell command injection — GLSA 200803-06
CVE-2008-0932.subTitle: Insufficient input checking in SWORD may allow shell command injection.
CVE-2008-0932.background: SWORD is a library for Bible study software.
CVE-2008-0932.body: Dan Dennison reported that the diatheke.pl script used in SWORD does not properly sanitize shell meta-characters in the "range" parameter before processing it.
CVE-2008-0932.extra: A remote attacker could provide specially crafted input to a vulnerable application, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the user running SWORD (generally the web server account).

CVE-2008-0947.title: MIT Kerberos 5: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-31
CVE-2008-0947.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in MIT Kerberos 5, which could allow a remote unauthenticated user to execute arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2008-0947.background: MIT Kerberos 5 is a suite of applications that implement the Kerberos network protocol. kadmind is the MIT Kerberos 5 administration daemon, KDC is the Key Distribution Center.
CVE-2008-0947.body: The first two vulnerabilities can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code on the host running krb5kdc, compromise the Kerberos key database or cause a Denial of Service. These bugs can only be triggered when Kerberos 4 support is enabled.
CVE-2008-0947.extra: The RPC related vulnerability can be exploited by a remote unauthenticated attacker to crash kadmind, and theoretically execute arbitrary code with root privileges or cause database corruption. This bug can only be triggered in configurations that allow large numbers of open file descriptors in a process.

CVE-2008-0960.title: Net-SNMP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200808-02
CVE-2008-0960.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Net-SNMP allow for authentication bypass in snmpd and execution of arbitrary code in Perl applications using Net-SMNP.
CVE-2008-0960.background: Net-SNMP is a collection of tools for generating and retrieving SNMP data. The SNMPv3 protocol uses a keyed-Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to verify data integrity and authenticity of SNMP messages.
CVE-2008-0960.body: Wes Hardaker reported that the SNMPv3 HMAC verification relies on the client to specify the HMAC length (CVE-2008-0960). John Kortink reported a buffer overflow in the Perl bindings of Net-SNMP when processing the OCTETSTRING in an attribute value pair (AVP) received by an SNMP agent (CVE-2008-2292).
CVE-2008-0960.extra: An attacker could send SNMPv3 packets to an instance of snmpd providing a valid user name and an HMAC length value of 1, and easily conduct brute-force attacks to bypass SNMP authentication. An attacker could further entice a user to connect to a malicious SNMP agent with an SNMP client using the Perl bindings, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-0983.title: lighttpd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-10
CVE-2008-0983.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in lighttpd.
CVE-2008-0983.background: lighttpd is a lightweight high-performance web server.
CVE-2008-0983.body: lighttpd contains a calculation error when allocating the global file descriptor array (CVE-2008-0983). Furthermore, it sends the source of a CGI script instead of returning a 500 error (Internal Server Error) when the fork() system call fails (CVE-2008-1111).
CVE-2008-0983.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or gain the source of a CGI script.

CVE-2008-1066.title: phpDocumentor: Function call injection — GLSA 201111-04
CVE-2008-1066.subTitle: phpDocumentor bundles Smarty which contains an input sanitation flaw, allowing attackers to call arbitrary PHP functions.
CVE-2008-1066.background: The phpDocumentor package provides automatic documenting of PHP API directly from the source.
CVE-2008-1066.body: phpDocumentor bundles Smarty with the modifier.regex_replace.php plug-in which does not properly sanitize input related to the ASCII NUL character in a search string.
CVE-2008-1066.extra: A remote attacker could call arbitrary PHP functions via templates.

CVE-2008-1071.title: Wireshark: Denial of service — GLSA 200803-32
CVE-2008-1071.subTitle: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark.
CVE-2008-1071.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2008-1071.body: Multiple unspecified errors exist in the SCTP, SNMP, and TFTP dissectors.
CVE-2008-1071.extra: A remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service by sending a malformed packet.

CVE-2008-1080.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-09
CVE-2008-1080.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for file disclosure, privilege escalation and Cross-Site scripting.
CVE-2008-1080.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-1080.body: Mozilla discovered that Opera does not handle input to file form fields properly, allowing scripts to manipulate the file path (CVE-2008-1080). Max Leonov found out that image comments might be treated as scripts, and run within the wrong security context (CVE-2008-1081). Arnaud reported that a wrong representation of DOM attribute values of imported XML documents allows them to bypass sanitization filters (CVE-2008-1082).
CVE-2008-1080.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to upload a file with a known path by entering text into a specially crafted form, to execute scripts outside intended security boundaries and conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

CVE-2008-1081.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-09
CVE-2008-1081.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for file disclosure, privilege escalation and Cross-Site scripting.
CVE-2008-1081.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-1081.body: Mozilla discovered that Opera does not handle input to file form fields properly, allowing scripts to manipulate the file path (CVE-2008-1080). Max Leonov found out that image comments might be treated as scripts, and run within the wrong security context (CVE-2008-1081). Arnaud reported that a wrong representation of DOM attribute values of imported XML documents allows them to bypass sanitization filters (CVE-2008-1082).
CVE-2008-1081.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to upload a file with a known path by entering text into a specially crafted form, to execute scripts outside intended security boundaries and conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

CVE-2008-1082.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-09
CVE-2008-1082.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for file disclosure, privilege escalation and Cross-Site scripting.
CVE-2008-1082.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-1082.body: Mozilla discovered that Opera does not handle input to file form fields properly, allowing scripts to manipulate the file path (CVE-2008-1080). Max Leonov found out that image comments might be treated as scripts, and run within the wrong security context (CVE-2008-1081). Arnaud reported that a wrong representation of DOM attribute values of imported XML documents allows them to bypass sanitization filters (CVE-2008-1082).
CVE-2008-1082.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to upload a file with a known path by entering text into a specially crafted form, to execute scripts outside intended security boundaries and conduct Cross-Site Scripting attacks.

CVE-2008-1097.title: GraphicsMagick: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201311-10
CVE-2008-1097.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in GraphicsMagick, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.
CVE-2008-1097.background: GraphicsMagick is the Swiss army knife of image processing.
CVE-2008-1097.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in GraphicsMagick. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2008-1097.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially-crafted image file, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service condition.

CVE-2008-1100.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-19
CVE-2008-1100.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1100.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-1100.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised), or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1105.title: Samba: Heap-based buffer overflow — GLSA 200805-23
CVE-2008-1105.subTitle: A heap-based buffer overflow vulnerability was found in Samba, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1105.background: Samba is a suite of SMB and CIFS client/server programs.
CVE-2008-1105.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) reported a vulnerability in Samba within the receive_smb_raw() function in the file lib/util_sock.c when parsing SMB packets, possibly leading to a heap-based buffer overflow via an overly large SMB packet.
CVE-2008-1105.extra: A remote attacker could possibly exploit this vulnerability by enticing a user to connect to a malicious server or by sending specially crafted packets to an nmbd server configured as a local or domain master browser, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-1108.title: Evolution: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200806-06
CVE-2008-1108.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Evolution may allow for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1108.background: Evolution is the mail client of the GNOME desktop environment.
CVE-2008-1108.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) reported two vulnerabilities in Evolution:
CVE-2008-1108.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted iCalendar attachment, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Evolution.

CVE-2008-1109.title: Evolution: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200806-06
CVE-2008-1109.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Evolution may allow for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1109.background: Evolution is the mail client of the GNOME desktop environment.
CVE-2008-1109.body: Alin Rad Pop (Secunia Research) reported two vulnerabilities in Evolution:
CVE-2008-1109.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted iCalendar attachment, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Evolution.

CVE-2008-1110.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200802-12
CVE-2008-1110.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing FLAC and ASF streams.
CVE-2008-1110.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player.
CVE-2008-1110.body: Damian Frizza and Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) discovered a stack-based buffer overflow within the open_flac_file() function in the file demux_flac.c when parsing tags within a FLAC file (CVE-2008-0486). A buffer overflow when parsing ASF headers, which is similar to CVE-2006-1664, has also been discovered (CVE-2008-1110).
CVE-2008-1110.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to play specially crafted FLAC or ASF video streams with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-1111.title: lighttpd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-10
CVE-2008-1111.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in lighttpd.
CVE-2008-1111.background: lighttpd is a lightweight high-performance web server.
CVE-2008-1111.body: lighttpd contains a calculation error when allocating the global file descriptor array (CVE-2008-0983). Furthermore, it sends the source of a CGI script instead of returning a 500 error (Internal Server Error) when the fork() system call fails (CVE-2008-1111).
CVE-2008-1111.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or gain the source of a CGI script.

CVE-2008-1142.title: Multiple X11 terminals: Local privilege escalation — GLSA 200805-03
CVE-2008-1142.subTitle: A vulnerability was found in aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, RXVT, rxvt-unicode, and wterm, allowing for local privilege escalation.
CVE-2008-1142.background: Aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, RXVT, rxvt-unicode, and wterm are X11 terminal emulators.
CVE-2008-1142.body: Bernhard R. Link discovered that RXVT opens a terminal on :0 if the "-display" option is not specified and the DISPLAY environment variable is not set. Further research by the Gentoo Security Team has shown that aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, rxvt-unicode, and wterm are also affected.
CVE-2008-1142.extra: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack X11 terminals of other users.

CVE-2008-1185.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2008-1185.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2008-1185.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.
CVE-2008-1185.body: Because of sharing the same codebase, JRockit is affected by the vulnerabilities mentioned in GLSA 200804-20.
CVE-2008-1185.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run a specially crafted applet on a website or start an application in Java Web Start to execute arbitrary code outside of the Java sandbox and of the Java security restrictions with the privileges of the user running Java. The attacker could also obtain sensitive information, create, modify, rename and read local files, execute local applications, establish connections in the local network, bypass the same origin policy, and cause a Denial of Service via multiple vectors.

CVE-2008-1186.title: JRockit: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-28
CVE-2008-1186.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified in BEA JRockit.
CVE-2008-1186.background: JRockit is BEA WebLogic's J2SE Development Kit.

CVE-2008-1227.title: SILC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-27
CVE-2008-1227.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in SILC Client, Server, and Toolkit, allowing for Denial of Service and execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1227.background: SILC (Secure Internet Live Conferencing protocol) Toolkit is a software development kit for use in clients, SILC Server is a communication server, and SILC Client is an IRSSI-based text client.
CVE-2008-1227.body: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.
CVE-2008-1227.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-1270.title: lighttpd: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-08
CVE-2008-1270.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in lighttpd may lead to information disclosure or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1270.background: lighttpd is a lightweight high-performance web server.
CVE-2008-1270.body: Julien Cayzax discovered that an insecure default setting exists in mod_userdir in lighttpd. When userdir.path is not set the default value used is $HOME. It should be noted that the "nobody" user's $HOME is "/" (CVE-2008-1270). An error also exists in the SSL connection code which can be triggered when a user prematurely terminates his connection (CVE-2008-1531).
CVE-2008-1270.extra: A remote attacker could exploit the first vulnerability to read arbitrary files. The second vulnerability can be exploited by a remote attacker to cause a Denial of Service by terminating a victim's SSL connection.

CVE-2008-1284.title: Horde Application Framework: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-01
CVE-2008-1284.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Horde Application Framework may lead to the execution of arbitrary files, information disclosure, and allow a remote attacker to bypass security restrictions.
CVE-2008-1284.background: The Horde Application Framework is a general-purpose web application framework written in PHP, providing classes for handling preferences, compression, browser detection, connection tracking, MIME and more.
CVE-2008-1284.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the Horde Application Framework:
CVE-2008-1284.extra: The first vulnerability can be exploited by a remote attacker to read arbitrary files and by remote authenticated attackers to execute arbitrary files. The second vulnerability can be exploited by authenticated remote attackers to perform restricted operations.

CVE-2008-1290.title: ViewVC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-29
CVE-2008-1290.subTitle: Multiple security issues have been reported in ViewVC, which can be exploited by malicious people to bypass certain security restrictions.
CVE-2008-1290.background: ViewVC is a browser interface for CVS and Subversion version control repositories.
CVE-2008-1290.body: Multiple unspecified errors were reportedly fixed by the ViewVC development team.
CVE-2008-1290.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted URL to the server to list CVS or SVN commits on "all-forbidden" files, access hidden CVSROOT folders, and view restricted content via the revision view, the log history, or the diff view.

CVE-2008-1291.title: ViewVC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200803-29
CVE-2008-1291.subTitle: Multiple security issues have been reported in ViewVC, which can be exploited by malicious people to bypass certain security restrictions.
CVE-2008-1291.background: ViewVC is a browser interface for CVS and Subversion version control repositories.
CVE-2008-1291.body: Multiple unspecified errors were reportedly fixed by the ViewVC development team.
CVE-2008-1291.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted URL to the server to list CVS or SVN commits on "all-forbidden" files, access hidden CVSROOT folders, and view restricted content via the revision view, the log history, or the diff view.

CVE-2008-1292.background: ViewVC is a browser interface for CVS and Subversion version control repositories.
CVE-2008-1292.body: Multiple unspecified errors were reportedly fixed by the ViewVC development team.
CVE-2008-1292.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted URL to the server to list CVS or SVN commits on "all-forbidden" files, access hidden CVSROOT folders, and view restricted content via the revision view, the log history, or the diff view.

CVE-2008-1332.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-13
CVE-2008-1332.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for SQL injection, session hijacking and unauthorized usage.
CVE-2008-1332.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and tool kit.
CVE-2008-1332.body: Asterisk upstream developers reported multiple vulnerabilities:
CVE-2008-1332.extra: Remote authenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk to execute arbitrary SQL commands and compromise the administrative database. Remote unauthenticated attackers could bypass authentication using a valid username to hijack other user's sessions, and establish sessions on the SIP channel without authentication.

CVE-2008-1340.title: VMware Player, Server, Workstation: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-25
CVE-2008-1340.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation, allowing remote and local attackers to conduct several attacks, including privilege escalation, remote execution of arbitrary code, and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1340.background: VMware Player, Server, and Workstation allow emulation of a complete PC on a PC without the usual performance overhead of most emulators.
CVE-2008-1340.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2008-1340.extra: Local users may be able to gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, or gain sensitive information.

CVE-2008-1372.title: Analog: Denial of service — GLSA 200903-40
CVE-2008-1372.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability was discovered in Analog.
CVE-2008-1372.background: Analog is a a webserver log analyzer.
CVE-2008-1372.body: Diego E. Petteno reported that the Analog package in Gentoo is built with its own copy of bzip2, making it vulnerable to CVE-2008-1372 (GLSA 200804-02).
CVE-2008-1372.extra: A local attacker could place specially crafted log files into a log directory being analyzed by analog, e.g. /var/log/apache, resulting in a crash when being processed by the application.

CVE-2008-1373.title: CUPS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-01
CVE-2008-1373.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in CUPS, allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1373.background: CUPS provides a portable printing layer for UNIX-based operating systems.
CVE-2008-1373.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in CUPS:
CVE-2008-1373.extra: A local attacker could send specially crafted network packets or print jobs and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running CUPS (usually lp), or cause a Denial of Service. The vulnerabilities are exploitable via the network when CUPS is sharing printers remotely.

CVE-2008-1377.title: X.Org X server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-07
CVE-2008-1377.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server, possibly allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2008-1377.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2008-1377.body: Regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extensions via iDefense:
CVE-2008-1377.extra: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could possibly lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, if the server is running as root, which is the default. It is also possible to crash the server by making use of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2008-1379.title: X.Org X server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-07
CVE-2008-1379.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server, possibly allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2008-1379.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2008-1379.body: Regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extensions via iDefense:
CVE-2008-1379.extra: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could possibly lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, if the server is running as root, which is the default. It is also possible to crash the server by making use of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2008-1380.title: Mozilla products: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200808-03
CVE-2008-1380.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Mozilla Firefox, Thunderbird, SeaMonkey and XULRunner, some of which may allow user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1380.background: Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser and Mozilla Thunderbird an open-source email client, both from the Mozilla Project. The SeaMonkey project is a community effort to deliver production-quality releases of code derived from the application formerly known as the 'Mozilla Application Suite'. XULRunner is a Mozilla runtime package that can be used to bootstrap XUL+XPCOM applications like Firefox and Thunderbird.
CVE-2008-1380.body: The following vulnerabilities were reported in all mentioned Mozilla products:
CVE-2008-1380.extra: The following vulnerabilities were reported in Firefox, SeaMonkey and XULRunner:

CVE-2008-1382.title: libpng: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-15
CVE-2008-1382.subTitle: A vulnerability in libpng may allow for execution of arbitrary code in certain applications that handle untrusted images.
CVE-2008-1382.background: libpng is a free ANSI C library used to process and manipulate PNG images.
CVE-2008-1382.body: Tavis Ormandy of the Google Security Team discovered that libpng does not handle zero-length unknown chunks in PNG files correctly, which might lead to memory corruption in applications that call png_set_read_user_chunk_fn() or png_set_keep_unknown_chunks().
CVE-2008-1382.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process a specially crafted PNG image in an application using libpng and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Note that processing of unknown chunks is disabled by default in most PNG applications, but some such as ImageMagick are affected.

CVE-2008-1382.title: Pngcrush: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200805-10
CVE-2008-1382.subTitle: A vulnerability in Pngcrush might result in user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1382.background: Pngcrush is a multi platform optimizer for PNG (Portable Network Graphics) files.
CVE-2008-1382.body: It has been reported that Pngcrush includes a copy of libpng that is vulnerable to a memory corruption (GLSA 200804-15).
CVE-2008-1382.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted PNG image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1382.title: POV-Ray: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-15
CVE-2008-1382.subTitle: POV-Ray includes a version of libpng that might allow for the execution of arbitrary code when reading a specially crafted PNG file
CVE-2008-1382.background: POV-Ray is a well known open-source ray tracer.
CVE-2008-1382.body: POV-Ray uses a statically linked copy of libpng to view and output PNG files. The version shipped with POV-Ray is vulnerable to CVE-2008-3964, CVE-2008-1382, CVE-2006-3334, CVE-2006-0481, CVE-2004-0768. A bug in POV-Ray's build system caused it to load the old version when your installed copy of libpng was >=media-libs/libpng-1.2.10.
CVE-2008-1382.extra: An attacker could entice a user to load a specially crafted PNG file as a texture, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-1383.title: ssl-cert eclass: Certificate disclosure — GLSA 200803-30
CVE-2008-1383.subTitle: An error in the usage of the ssl-cert eclass within multiple ebuilds might allow for disclosure of generated SSL private keys.
CVE-2008-1383.background: The ssl-cert eclass is a code module used by Gentoo ebuilds to generate SSL certificates.
CVE-2008-1383.body: Robin Johnson reported that the docert() function provided by ssl-cert.eclass can be called by source building stages of an ebuild, such as src_compile() or src_install(), which will result in the generated SSL keys being included inside binary packages (binpkgs).
CVE-2008-1383.extra: A local attacker could recover the SSL keys from publicly readable binary packages when "emerge" is called with the "--buildpkg (-b)" or "--buildpkgonly (-B)" option. Remote attackers can recover these keys if the packages are served to a network. Binary packages built using "quickpkg" are not affected.

CVE-2008-1384.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200811-05
CVE-2008-1384.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1384.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2008-1384.body: Several vulnerabilitites were found in PHP:
CVE-2008-1384.extra: These vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, to cause a Denial of Service, to circumvent security restrictions, to disclose information, and to manipulate files.

CVE-2008-1389.title: ClamAV: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200809-18
CVE-2008-1389.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1389.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-1389.body: Hanno boeck reported an error in libclamav/chmunpack.c when processing CHM files (CVE-2008-1389). Other unspecified vulnerabilities were also reported, including a NULL pointer dereference in libclamav (CVE-2008-3912), memory leaks in freshclam/manager.c (CVE-2008-3913), and file descriptor leaks in libclamav/others.c and libclamav/sis.c (CVE-2008-3914).
CVE-2008-1389.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted CHM, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash). The other attack vectors mentioned above could also result in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1419.title: libvorbis: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-09
CVE-2008-1419.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1419.background: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.
CVE-2008-1419.body: Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reported multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis:
CVE-2008-1419.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to open a specially crafted Ogg Vorbis file or network stream with an application using libvorbis. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user playing the file or a Denial of Service by a crash or CPU consumption.

CVE-2008-1420.title: libvorbis: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-09
CVE-2008-1420.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1420.background: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.
CVE-2008-1420.body: Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reported multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis:
CVE-2008-1420.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to open a specially crafted Ogg Vorbis file or network stream with an application using libvorbis. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user playing the file or a Denial of Service by a crash or CPU consumption.

CVE-2008-1423.title: libvorbis: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-09
CVE-2008-1423.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1423.background: libvorbis is the reference implementation of the Xiph.org Ogg Vorbis audio file format. It is used by many applications for playback of Ogg Vorbis files.
CVE-2008-1423.body: Will Drewry of the Google Security Team reported multiple vulnerabilities in libvorbis:
CVE-2008-1423.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to open a specially crafted Ogg Vorbis file or network stream with an application using libvorbis. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user playing the file or a Denial of Service by a crash or CPU consumption.

CVE-2008-1474.title: Roundup: Permission bypass — GLSA 200805-21
CVE-2008-1474.subTitle: A vulnerability in Roundup allows for bypassing permission restrictions.
CVE-2008-1474.background: Roundup is an issue-tracking system with command-line, web and e-mail interfaces.
CVE-2008-1474.body: Philipp Gortan reported that the xml-rpc server in Roundup does not check property permissions (CVE-2008-1475). Furthermore, Roland Meister discovered multiple vulnerabilities caused by unspecified errors, some of which may be related to cross-site scripting (CVE-2008-1474).
CVE-2008-1474.extra: A remote attacker could possibly exploit the first vulnerability to edit or view restricted properties via the list(), display(), and set() methods. The impact and attack vectors of the second vulnerability are unknown.

CVE-2008-1475.title: Roundup: Permission bypass — GLSA 200805-21
CVE-2008-1475.subTitle: A vulnerability in Roundup allows for bypassing permission restrictions.
CVE-2008-1475.background: Roundup is an issue-tracking system with command-line, web and e-mail interfaces.
CVE-2008-1475.body: Philipp Gortan reported that the xml-rpc server in Roundup does not check property permissions (CVE-2008-1475). Furthermore, Roland Meister discovered multiple vulnerabilities caused by unspecified errors, some of which may be related to cross-site scripting (CVE-2008-1474).
CVE-2008-1475.extra: A remote attacker could possibly exploit the first vulnerability to edit or view restricted properties via the list(), display(), and set() methods. The impact and attack vectors of the second vulnerability are unknown.

CVE-2008-1482.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200808-01
CVE-2008-1482.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing media streams.
CVE-2008-1482.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player, and other players such as Amarok, Codeine/Dragon Player and Kaffeine.
CVE-2008-1482.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in xine-lib:
CVE-2008-1482.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to play a specially crafted video file or stream with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-1488.title: PECL APC: Buffer Overflow — GLSA 200804-07
CVE-2008-1488.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability in PECL APC might allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1488.background: PECL Alternative PHP Cache (PECL APC) is a free, open, and robust framework for caching and optimizing PHP intermediate code.
CVE-2008-1488.body: Daniel Papasian discovered a stack-based buffer overflow in the apc_search_paths() function in the file apc.c when processing long filenames.
CVE-2008-1488.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code in PHP applications that pass user-controlled input to the include() function.

CVE-2008-1489.title: VLC: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-25
CVE-2008-1489.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1489.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2008-1489.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC:
CVE-2008-1489.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file or stream, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-1552.title: SILC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-27
CVE-2008-1552.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in SILC Client, Server, and Toolkit, allowing for Denial of Service and execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1552.background: SILC (Secure Internet Live Conferencing protocol) Toolkit is a software development kit for use in clients, SILC Server is a communication server, and SILC Client is an IRSSI-based text client.
CVE-2008-1552.body: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.
CVE-2008-1552.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-1558.title: MPlayer: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200805-22
CVE-2008-1558.subTitle: An integer overflow vulnerability in MPlayer may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1558.background: MPlayer is a media player including support for a wide range of audio and video formats.
CVE-2008-1558.body: k`sOSe reported an integer overflow vulnerability in the sdpplin_parse() function in the file stream/realrtsp/sdpplin.c, which can be exploited to overwrite arbitrary memory regions via an overly large "StreamCount" SDP parameter.
CVE-2008-1558.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running MPlayer.

CVE-2008-1568.title: Comix: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-29
CVE-2008-1568.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Comix may lead to execution of arbitrary commands and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1568.background: Comix is a GTK comic book viewer.
CVE-2008-1568.body: Comix does not properly sanitize filenames containing shell metacharacters when they are passed to the rar, unrar, or jpegtran programs (CVE-2008-1568). Comix also creates directories with predictable names (CVE-2008-1796).
CVE-2008-1568.extra: A remote attacker could exploit the first vulnerability by enticing a user to use Comix to open a file with a specially crafted filename, resulting in the execution of arbitrary commands. The second vulnerability could be exploited by a local attacker to cause a Denial of Service by creating a file or directory with the same filename as the predictable filename used by Comix.

CVE-2008-1612.title: Squid: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-38
CVE-2008-1612.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Squid which allow for remote Denial of Service attacks.
CVE-2008-1612.background: Squid is a full-featured web proxy cache.
CVE-2008-1612.body: The issues allows for Denial of Service attacks against the service via an HTTP request with an invalid version number and other specially crafted requests.
CVE-2008-1612.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-1628.title: Linux Audit: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200807-14
CVE-2008-1628.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability in Linux Audit may allow local attackers to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1628.background: Linux Audit is a set of userspace utilities for storing and processing auditing records.
CVE-2008-1628.body: A stack-based buffer overflow has been reported in the audit_log_user_command() function in the file lib/audit_logging.c when processing overly long arguments.
CVE-2008-1628.extra: A local attacker could execute a specially crafted command on the host running Linux Audit, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Linux Audit.

CVE-2008-1637.title: PowerDNS Recursor: DNS Cache Poisoning — GLSA 200804-22
CVE-2008-1637.subTitle: Use of insufficient randomness in PowerDNS Recursor might lead to DNS cache poisoning.
CVE-2008-1637.background: The PowerDNS Recursor is an advanced recursing nameserver.
CVE-2008-1637.body: Amit Klein of Trusteer reported that insufficient randomness is used to calculate the TRXID values and the UDP source port numbers (CVE-2008-1637). Thomas Biege of SUSE pointed out that a prior fix to resolve this issue was incomplete, as it did not always enable the stronger random number generator for source port selection (CVE-2008-3217).
CVE-2008-1637.extra: A remote attacker could send malicious answers to insert arbitrary DNS data into the cache. These attacks would in turn help an attacker to perform man-in-the-middle and site impersonation attacks.

CVE-2008-1672.title: OpenSSL: Denial of service — GLSA 200806-08
CVE-2008-1672.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities might allow for a Denial of Service of daemons using OpenSSL.
CVE-2008-1672.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2008-1672.body: Ossi Herrala and Jukka Taimisto of Codenomicon discovered two vulnerabilities:
CVE-2008-1672.extra: A remote attacker could connect to a vulnerable server, or entice a daemon to connect to a malicious server, causing a Denial of Service of the daemon in both cases.

CVE-2008-1678.title: Apache: Denial of service — GLSA 200807-06
CVE-2008-1678.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Apache might lead to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1678.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2008-1678.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache:
CVE-2008-1678.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by connecting to an Apache httpd, by causing an Apache proxy server to connect to a malicious server, or by enticing a balancer administrator to connect to a specially-crafted URL, resulting in a Denial of Service of the Apache daemon.

CVE-2008-1679.title: Python: Multiple integer overflows — GLSA 200807-01
CVE-2008-1679.subTitle: Multiple integer overflows may allow for Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1679.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-1679.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-1679.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or possibly the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Python.

CVE-2008-1686.title: Speex: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-17
CVE-2008-1686.subTitle: Improper input validation in Speex might lead to array indexing vulnerabilities in multiple player applications.
CVE-2008-1686.background: Speex is an audio compression format designed for speech that is free of patent restrictions.
CVE-2008-1686.body: oCERT reported that the Speex library does not properly validate the "mode" value it derives from Speex streams, allowing for array indexing vulnerabilities inside multiple player applications. Within Gentoo, xine-lib, VLC, gst-plugins-speex from the GStreamer Good Plug-ins, vorbis-tools, libfishsound, Sweep, SDL_sound, and speexdec were found to be vulnerable.
CVE-2008-1686.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted Speex file or network stream with an application listed above. This might lead to the execution of arbitrary code with privileges of the user playing the file.

CVE-2008-1692.title: Multiple X11 terminals: Local privilege escalation — GLSA 200805-03
CVE-2008-1692.subTitle: A vulnerability was found in aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, RXVT, rxvt-unicode, and wterm, allowing for local privilege escalation.
CVE-2008-1692.background: Aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, RXVT, rxvt-unicode, and wterm are X11 terminal emulators.
CVE-2008-1692.body: Bernhard R. Link discovered that RXVT opens a terminal on :0 if the "-display" option is not specified and the DISPLAY environment variable is not set. Further research by the Gentoo Security Team has shown that aterm, Eterm, Mrxvt, multi-aterm, rxvt-unicode, and wterm are also affected.
CVE-2008-1692.extra: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to hijack X11 terminals of other users.

CVE-2008-1693.title: Poppler: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-18
CVE-2008-1693.subTitle: Poppler does not handle fonts inside PDF files safely, allowing for execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1693.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf.
CVE-2008-1693.body: Kees Cook from the Ubuntu Security Team reported that the CairoFont::create() function in the file CairoFontEngine.cc does not verify the type of an embedded font object inside a PDF file before dereferencing a function pointer from it.
CVE-2008-1693.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF file with a Poppler-based PDF viewer such as Gentoo's Xpdf, Epdfview, or Evince, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-1720.title: rsync: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-16
CVE-2008-1720.subTitle: A buffer overflow in rsync might lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code when extended attributes are being used.
CVE-2008-1720.background: rsync is a file transfer program to keep remote directories synchronized.
CVE-2008-1720.body: Sebastian Krahmer of SUSE reported an integer overflow in the expand_item_list() function in the file util.c which might lead to a heap-based buffer overflow when extended attribute (xattr) support is enabled.
CVE-2008-1720.extra: A remote attacker could send a file containing specially crafted extended attributes to an rsync deamon, or entice a user to sync from an rsync server containing specially crafted files, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-1721.title: Python: Multiple integer overflows — GLSA 200807-01
CVE-2008-1721.subTitle: Multiple integer overflows may allow for Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1721.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-1721.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-1721.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or possibly the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Python.

CVE-2008-1728.title: Openfire: Denial of service — GLSA 200804-26
CVE-2008-1728.subTitle: A design error in Openfire might lead to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1728.background: Openfire (formerly Wildfire) is a Java implementation of a complete Jabber server.
CVE-2008-1728.body: Openfire's connection manager in the file ConnectionManagerImpl.java cannot handle clients that fail to read messages, and has no limit on their session's send buffer.
CVE-2008-1728.extra: Remote authenticated attackers could trigger large outgoing queues without reading messages, causing a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1734.title: PHP Toolkit: Data disclosure and Denial of service — GLSA 200804-19
CVE-2008-1734.subTitle: PHP Toolkit does not quote parameters, allowing for PHP source code disclosure on Apache, and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1734.background: PHP Toolkit is a utility to manage parallel installations of PHP within Gentoo. It is executed by the PHP ebuilds at setup.
CVE-2008-1734.body: Toni Arnold, David Sveningsson, Michal Bartoszkiewicz, and Joseph reported that php-select does not quote parameters passed to the "tr" command, which could convert the "-D PHP5" argument in the "APACHE2_OPTS" setting in the file /etc/conf.d/apache2 to lower case.
CVE-2008-1734.extra: An attacker could entice a system administrator to run "emerge php" or call "php-select -t apache2 php5" directly in a directory containing a lower case single-character named file, which would prevent Apache from loading mod_php and thereby disclose PHP source code and cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1761.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-14
CVE-2008-1761.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1761.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-1761.body: Michal Zalewski reported two vulnerabilities, memory corruption when adding news feed sources from a website (CVE-2008-1761) as well as when processing HTML CANVAS elements to use scaled images (CVE-2008-1762). Additionally, an unspecified weakness related to keyboard handling of password inputs has been reported (CVE-2008-1764).
CVE-2008-1761.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a specially crafted web site or news feed and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera.

CVE-2008-1762.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200804-14
CVE-2008-1762.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Opera, allowing for execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1762.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-1762.body: Michal Zalewski reported two vulnerabilities, memory corruption when adding news feed sources from a website (CVE-2008-1761) as well as when processing HTML CANVAS elements to use scaled images (CVE-2008-1762). Additionally, an unspecified weakness related to keyboard handling of password inputs has been reported (CVE-2008-1764).
CVE-2008-1762.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to visit a specially crafted web site or news feed and possibly execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Opera.

CVE-2008-1767.title: libxslt: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200806-02
CVE-2008-1767.subTitle: A vulnerability was found in libxslt, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code and Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1767.background: Libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT itself is an XML language to define transformations for XML.
CVE-2008-1767.body: Anthony de Almeida Lopes reported a vulnerability in libxslt when handling XSL style-sheet files, which could be exploited to trigger the use of uninitialized memory, e.g. in a call to "free()".
CVE-2008-1767.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to process an XML file using a specially crafted XSL transformation file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1768.title: VLC: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200804-25
CVE-2008-1768.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in VLC, allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-1801.extra: An attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by enticing a user to connect to a malicious RDP server thereby allowing the attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1802.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in rdesktop may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1803.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in rdesktop may lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1806.title: FreeType: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200806-10
CVE-2008-1806.subTitle: Font parsing vulnerabilities in FreeType might lead to user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-1806.background: FreeType is a font rendering library for TrueType Font (TTF) and Printer Font Binary (PFB).
CVE-2008-1806.body: Regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in FreeType via iDefense:
CVE-2008-1806.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TTF or PBF file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running an application linked against FreeType (such as the X.org X server, running as root).

CVE-2008-1806.title: VMware Player, Server, Workstation: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 201209-25
CVE-2008-1806.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation, allowing remote and local attackers to conduct several attacks, including privilege escalation, remote execution of arbitrary code, and a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1806.background: VMware Player, Server, and Workstation allow emulation of a complete PC on a PC without the usual performance overhead of most emulators.
CVE-2008-1806.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in VMware Player, Server, and Workstation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.
CVE-2008-1806.extra: Local users may be able to gain escalated privileges, cause a Denial of Service, or gain sensitive information.

CVE-2008-1833.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200805-19

CVE-2008-1833.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-1833.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running ClamAV (either a system user or the "clamav" user if clamd is compromised), or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1878.title: xine-lib: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200808-01
CVE-2008-1878.subTitle: xine-lib is vulnerable to multiple buffer overflows when processing media streams.
CVE-2008-1878.background: xine-lib is the core library package for the xine media player, and other players such as Amarok, Codeine/Dragon Player and Kaffeine.
CVE-2008-1878.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in xine-lib:
CVE-2008-1878.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to play a specially crafted video file or stream with a player using xine-lib, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the player.

CVE-2008-1881.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file or stream, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-1887.subTitle: Multiple integer overflows may allow for Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1887.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-1887.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-1887.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a Denial of Service or possibly the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running Python.

CVE-2008-1897.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-1897.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-1897.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.
CVE-2008-1897.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IAX2 channel driver when performing the 3-way handshake (CVE-2008-1897), when handling a large number of POKE requests (CVE-2008-3263), when handling authentication attempts (CVE-2008-5558) and when handling firmware download (FWDOWNL) requests (CVE-2008-3264). Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).
CVE-2008-1897.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service via a daemon crash, call-number exhaustion, CPU or traffic consumption. Remote unauthenticated attackers could furthermore enumerate valid usernames to facilitate brute force login attempts.

CVE-2008-1924.title: phpMyAdmin: Information disclosure — GLSA 200805-02
CVE-2008-1924.subTitle: A vulnerability in phpMyAdmin may lead to information disclosure.
CVE-2008-1924.background: phpMyAdmin is a tool written in PHP intended to handle the administration of MySQL databases from a web-browser.
CVE-2008-1924.body: Cezary Tomczak reported that an undefined UploadDir variable exposes an information disclosure vulnerability when running on shared hosts.
CVE-2008-1924.extra: A remote attacker with CREATE TABLE permissions can exploit this vulnerability via a specially crafted HTTP POST request in order to read arbitrary files.

CVE-2008-1925.title: InspIRCd: Denial of service — GLSA 200805-08
CVE-2008-1925.subTitle: A buffer overflow in InspIRCd allows remote attackers to cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-1925.background: InspIRCd (Inspire IRCd) is a modular C++ IRC daemon.
CVE-2008-1925.body: The "namesx" and "uhnames" modules do not properly validate network input, leading to a buffer overflow.
CVE-2008-1925.extra: A remote attacker can send specially crafted IRC commands to the server, causing a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-1937.title: MoinMoin: Privilege escalation — GLSA 200805-09
CVE-2008-1937.subTitle: A vulnerability in MoinMoin may allow a remote attacker to elevate his privileges.
CVE-2008-1937.background: MoinMoin is an advanced and extensible Wiki Engine.
CVE-2008-1937.body: It has been reported that the user form processing in the file userform.py does not properly manage users when using Access Control Lists or a non-empty superusers list.
CVE-2008-1937.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to gain superuser privileges on the application.

CVE-2008-1948.title: GnuTLS: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200805-20
CVE-2008-1948.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities might allow for the execution of arbitrary code in daemons using GnuTLS.
CVE-2008-1948.background: GnuTLS is an implementation of Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) 3.0 and Transport Layer Security (TLS) 1.0, 1.1 and 1.2.
CVE-2008-1948.body: Ossi Herrala and Jukka Taimisto of Codenomicon reported three vulnerabilities in libgnutls of GnuTLS:
CVE-2008-1948.extra: Unauthenticated remote attackers could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause Denial of Service conditions in daemons using GnuTLS. The first vulnerability (CVE-2008-1948) might allow for the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the daemon handling incoming TLS connections.

CVE-2008-2040.title: PeerCast: Buffer overflow — GLSA 200807-11
CVE-2008-2040.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability in PeerCast may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2040.background: PeerCast is a client and server for P2P-radio networks.
CVE-2008-2040.body: Nico Golde reported a boundary error in the HTTP::getAuthUserPass() function when processing overly long HTTP Basic authentication requests.
CVE-2008-2040.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted HTTP request to the vulnerable server, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2050.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200811-05
CVE-2008-2050.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2050.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2008-2050.body: Several vulnerabilitites were found in PHP:
CVE-2008-2050.extra: These vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, to cause a Denial of Service, to circumvent security restrictions, to disclose information, and to manipulate files.

CVE-2008-2080.title: Common Data Format library: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200805-14
CVE-2008-2080.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in the Common Data Format library.
CVE-2008-2080.background: The Common Data Format library is a scientific data management package which allows programmers and application developers to manage and manipulate scalar, vector, and multi-dimensional data arrays in a platform independent fashion.
CVE-2008-2080.body: Alfredo Ortega (Core Security Technologies) reported a boundary error within the Read32s_64() function when processing CDF files.
CVE-2008-2080.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted CDF file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2086.title: Sun JDK/JRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200911-02
CVE-2008-2086.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Sun JDK and JRE allow for several attacks, including the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2086.background: The Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) and the Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) provide the Sun Java platform.
CVE-2008-2086.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the Sun Java implementation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below and the associated Sun Alerts for details.
CVE-2008-2086.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JAR archive, applet, or Java Web Start application, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Furthermore, a remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service affecting multiple services via several vectors, disclose information and memory contents, write or execute local files, conduct session hijacking attacks via GIFAR files, steal cookies, bypass the same-origin policy, load untrusted JAR files, establish network connections to arbitrary hosts and posts via several vectors, modify the list of supported graphics configurations, bypass HMAC-based authentication systems, escalate privileges via several vectors and cause applet code to be executed with older, possibly vulnerable versions of the JRE.
