CVE-2008-2119.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-2119.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-2119.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.
CVE-2008-2119.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IAX2 channel driver when performing the 3-way handshake (CVE-2008-1897), when handling a large number of POKE requests (CVE-2008-3263), when handling authentication attempts (CVE-2008-5558) and when handling firmware download (FWDOWNL) requests (CVE-2008-3264). Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).
CVE-2008-2119.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service via a daemon crash, call-number exhaustion, CPU or traffic consumption. Remote unauthenticated attackers could furthermore enumerate valid usernames to facilitate brute force login attempts.

CVE-2008-2147.title: VLC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200807-13
CVE-2008-2147.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in VLC may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2147.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2008-2147.body: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted .wav file, and a local attacker could entice a user to run VLC from a directory containing specially crafted modules, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.
CVE-2008-2147.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-2152.title: OpenOffice.org: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200807-05
CVE-2008-2152.subTitle: An integer overflow vulnerability has been reported in OpenOffice.org.
CVE-2008-2152.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2008-2152.body: Sean Larsson (iDefense Labs) reported an integer overflow in the function rtl_allocateMemory() in the file sal/rtl/source/alloc_global.c.
CVE-2008-2152.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2235.title: OpenSC: Insufficient protection of smart card PIN — GLSA 200812-09
CVE-2008-2235.subTitle: Smart cards formatted using OpenSC do not sufficiently protect the PIN, allowing attackers to reset it.
CVE-2008-2235.background: OpenSC is a smart card application that allows reading and writing via PKCS#11.
CVE-2008-2235.body: Chaskiel M Grundman reported that OpenSC uses weak permissions (ADMIN file control information of 00) for the 5015 directory on smart cards and USB crypto tokens running Siemens CardOS M4.
CVE-2008-2235.extra: A physically proximate attacker can exploit this vulnerability to change the PIN on a smart card and use it for authentication, leading to privilege escalation.

CVE-2008-2237.title: OpenOffice.org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-13
CVE-2008-2237.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in OpenOffice.org might allow for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code or symlink attacks.
CVE-2008-2237.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2008-2237.body: Two heap-based buffer overflows when processing WMF files (CVE-2008-2237) and EMF files (CVE-2008-2238) were discovered. Dmitry E. Oboukhov also reported an insecure temporary file usage within the senddoc script (CVE-2008-4937).
CVE-2008-2237.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code. A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files on the system. Both cases happen with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2238.title: OpenOffice.org: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-13
CVE-2008-2238.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in OpenOffice.org might allow for user-assisted execution of arbitrary code or symlink attacks.
CVE-2008-2238.background: OpenOffice.org is an open source office productivity suite, including word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, drawing, data charting, formula editing, and file conversion facilities.
CVE-2008-2238.body: Two heap-based buffer overflows when processing WMF files (CVE-2008-2237) and EMF files (CVE-2008-2238) were discovered. Dmitry E. Oboukhov also reported an insecure temporary file usage within the senddoc script (CVE-2008-4937).
CVE-2008-2238.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted document, resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code. A local attacker could perform symlink attacks to overwrite arbitrary files on the system. Both cases happen with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2292.title: Net-SNMP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200808-02
CVE-2008-2292.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Net-SNMP allow for authentication bypass in snmpd and execution of arbitrary code in Perl applications using Net-SMNP.
CVE-2008-2292.background: Net-SNMP is a collection of tools for generating and retrieving SNMP data. The SNMPv3 protocol uses a keyed-Hash Message Authentication Code (HMAC) to verify data integrity and authenticity of SNMP messages.
CVE-2008-2292.body: Wes Hardaker reported that the SNMPv3 HMAC verification relies on the client to specify the HMAC length (CVE-2008-0960). John Kortink reported a buffer overflow in the Perl bindings of Net-SNMP when processing the OCTETSTRING in an attribute value pair (AVP) received by an SNMP agent (CVE-2008-2292).
CVE-2008-2292.extra: An attacker could send SNMPv3 packets to an instance of snmpd providing a valid user name and an HMAC length value of 1, and easily conduct brute-force attacks to bypass SNMP authentication. An attacker could further entice a user to connect to a malicious SNMP agent with an SNMP client using the Perl bindings, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-2315.title: Python: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200807-16
CVE-2008-2315.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Python may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2315.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-2315.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-2315.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities in Python applications or daemons that pass user-controlled input to vulnerable functions. Exploitation might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. Vulnerabilities within the hashlib might lead to weakened cryptographic protection of data integrity or authenticity.

CVE-2008-2316.title: Python: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200807-16
CVE-2008-2316.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Python may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2316.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-2316.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-2316.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities in Python applications or daemons that pass user-controlled input to vulnerable functions. Exploitation might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. Vulnerabilities within the hashlib might lead to weakened cryptographic protection of data integrity or authenticity.

CVE-2008-2327.title: libTIFF: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200809-07
CVE-2008-2327.subTitle: Multiple buffer underflow vulnerabilities in libTIFF may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2327.background: libTIFF provides support for reading and manipulating TIFF (Tagged Image File Format) images.
CVE-2008-2327.body: Drew Yao (Apple Product Security) and Clay Wood reported multiple buffer underflows in the LZWDecode() and LZWDecodeCompat() functions in tif_lzw.c when processing TIFF files.
CVE-2008-2327.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted TIFF file with an application making use of libTIFF, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2357.title: mtr: Stack-based buffer overflow — GLSA 200806-01
CVE-2008-2357.subTitle: A stack-based buffer overflow was found in mtr, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2357.background: mtr combines the functionality of the 'traceroute' and 'ping' programs in a single network diagnostic tool.
CVE-2008-2357.body: Adam Zabrocki reported a boundary error within the split_redraw() function in the file split.c, possibly leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2008-2357.extra: A remote attacker could use a specially crafted resolved hostname to execute arbitrary code with root privileges. However, it is required that the attacker controls the DNS server used by the victim, and that the "-p" (or "--split") command line option is used.

CVE-2008-2360.title: X.Org X server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-07
CVE-2008-2360.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server, possibly allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2008-2360.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2008-2360.body: Regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extensions via iDefense:
CVE-2008-2360.extra: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could possibly lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, if the server is running as root, which is the default. It is also possible to crash the server by making use of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2008-2361.extra: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could possibly lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, if the server is running as root, which is the default. It is also possible to crash the server by making use of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2008-2362.title: X.Org X server: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200806-07
CVE-2008-2362.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the X.Org X server, possibly allowing for the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges.
CVE-2008-2362.background: The X Window System is a graphical windowing system based on a client/server model.
CVE-2008-2362.body: Regenrecht reported multiple vulnerabilities in various X server extensions via iDefense:
CVE-2008-2362.extra: Exploitation of these vulnerabilities could possibly lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code with root privileges, if the server is running as root, which is the default. It is also possible to crash the server by making use of these vulnerabilities.

CVE-2008-2363.title: Pan: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200807-15
CVE-2008-2363.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability in Pan may allow remote attacker to execute arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2363.background: Pan is a newsreader for the GNOME desktop.
CVE-2008-2363.body: Pavel Polischouk reported a boundary error in the PartsBatch class when processing .nzb files.
CVE-2008-2363.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted .nzb file, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2364.title: Apache: Denial of service — GLSA 200807-06
CVE-2008-2364.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Apache might lead to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-2364.background: The Apache HTTP server is one of the most popular web servers on the Internet.
CVE-2008-2364.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Apache:
CVE-2008-2364.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by connecting to an Apache httpd, by causing an Apache proxy server to connect to a malicious server, or by enticing a balancer administrator to connect to a specially-crafted URL, resulting in a Denial of Service of the Apache daemon.

CVE-2008-2371.title: PHP: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200811-05
CVE-2008-2371.subTitle: PHP contains several vulnerabilities including buffer and integer overflows which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2371.background: PHP is a widely-used general-purpose scripting language that is especially suited for Web development and can be embedded into HTML.
CVE-2008-2371.body: Several vulnerabilitites were found in PHP:
CVE-2008-2371.extra: These vulnerabilities might allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code, to cause a Denial of Service, to circumvent security restrictions, to disclose information, and to manipulate files.

CVE-2008-2374.title: BlueZ: Arbitrary code execution — GLSA 200903-29
CVE-2008-2374.subTitle: Insufficient input validation in BlueZ may lead to arbitrary code execution or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-2374.background: BlueZ is a set of Bluetooth tools and system daemons for Linux.
CVE-2008-2374.body: It has been reported that the Bluetooth packet parser does not validate string length fields in SDP packets.
CVE-2008-2374.extra: A physically proximate attacker using a Bluetooth device with an already established trust relationship could send specially crafted requests, possibly leading to arbitrary code execution or a crash. Exploitation may also be triggered by a local attacker registering a service record via a UNIX socket or D-Bus interface.

CVE-2008-2380.title: Courier Authentication Library: SQL Injection vulnerability — GLSA 200903-25
CVE-2008-2380.subTitle: An SQL injection vulnerability has been discovered in the Courier Authentication Library.
CVE-2008-2380.background: The Courier Authentication Library is a generic authentication API that encapsulates the process of validating account passwords.
CVE-2008-2380.body: It has been reported that some parameters used in SQL queries are not properly sanitized before being processed when using a non-Latin locale Postgres database.
CVE-2008-2380.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted input to an application using the library, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary SQL commands.

CVE-2008-2420.title: stunnel: Security bypass — GLSA 200808-08
CVE-2008-2420.subTitle: stunnel does not properly prevent the authentication of a revoked certificate which would be published by OCSP.
CVE-2008-2420.background: The stunnel program is designed to work as an SSL encryption wrapper between a remote client and a local or remote server. OCSP (Online Certificate Status Protocol), as described in RFC 2560, is an internet protocol used for obtaining the revocation status of an X.509 digital certificate.
CVE-2008-2420.body: An unspecified bug in the OCSP search functionality of stunnel has been discovered.
CVE-2008-2420.extra: A remote attacker can use a revoked certificate that would be successfully authenticated by stunnel. This issue only concerns the users who have enabled the OCSP validation in stunnel.

CVE-2008-2430.title: VLC: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200807-13
CVE-2008-2430.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in VLC may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2430.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2008-2430.body: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted .wav file, and a local attacker could entice a user to run VLC from a directory containing specially crafted modules, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.
CVE-2008-2430.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-2469.title: libspf2: DNS response buffer overflow — GLSA 200810-03
CVE-2008-2469.subTitle: A memory management error in libspf2 might allow for remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2469.background: libspf2 is a library that implements the Sender Policy Framework, allowing mail transfer agents to make sure that an email is authorized by the domain name that it is coming from. Currently, only the exim MTA uses libspf2 in Gentoo.
CVE-2008-2469.body: libspf2 uses a fixed-length buffer to receive DNS responses and does not properly check the length of TXT records, leading to buffer overflows.
CVE-2008-2469.extra: A remote attacker could store a specially crafted DNS entry and entice a user or automated system using libspf2 to lookup that SPF entry (e.g. by sending an email to the MTA), possibly allowing for the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-2575.title: cbrPager: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200806-05
CVE-2008-2575.subTitle: Insecure filename usage in cbrPager may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2575.background: cbrPager is a comic book pager.
CVE-2008-2575.body: Mamoru Tasaka discovered that filenames of the image archives are not properly sanitized before being passed to decompression utilities like unrar and unzip, which use the system() libc library call.
CVE-2008-2575.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open an archive with a specially crafted filename, resulting in arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2654.title: Motion: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200807-02
CVE-2008-2654.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Motion might result in the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2654.background: Motion is a program that monitors the video signal from one or more cameras and is able to detect motions.
CVE-2008-2654.body: Nico Golde reported an off-by-one error within the read_client() function in the webhttpd.c file, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow. Stefan Cornelius (Secunia Research) reported a boundary error within the same function, also leading to a stack-based buffer overflow. Both vulnerabilities require that the HTTP Control interface is enabled.
CVE-2008-2654.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending an overly long or specially crafted request to a vulnerable Motion HTTP control interface, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the motion user.

CVE-2008-2713.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-2713.body: Damian Put has discovered an out-of-bounds memory access while processing Petite files (CVE-2008-2713, CVE-2008-3215). Also, please note that the 0.93 ClamAV branch fixes the first of the two attack vectors of CVE-2007-6595 concerning an insecure creation of temporary files vulnerability. The sigtool attack vector seems still unfixed.
CVE-2008-2713.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted Petite file, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash). Also, the insecure creation of temporary files vulnerability can be triggered by a local user to perform a symlink attack.

CVE-2008-2935.title: libxslt: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200808-06
CVE-2008-2935.subTitle: libxslt is affected by a heap-based buffer overflow, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2935.background: libxslt is the XSLT C library developed for the GNOME project. XSLT is an XML language to define transformations for XML.
CVE-2008-2935.body: Chris Evans (Google Security) reported that the libexslt library that is part of libxslt is affected by a heap-based buffer overflow in the RC4 encryption/decryption functions.
CVE-2008-2935.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process an XML file using a specially crafted XSLT stylesheet in an application linked against libxslt, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2936.title: Postfix: Local privilege escalation vulnerability — GLSA 200808-12
CVE-2008-2936.subTitle: Postfix incorrectly checks the ownership of a mailbox, allowing, in certain circumstances, to append data to arbitrary files on a local system with root privileges.
CVE-2008-2936.background: Postfix is Wietse Venema's mailer that attempts to be fast, easy to administer, and secure, as an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.
CVE-2008-2936.body: Sebastian Krahmer of SuSE has found that Postfix allows to deliver mail to root-owned symlinks in an insecure manner under certain conditions. Normally, Postfix does not deliver mail to symlinks, except to root-owned symlinks, for compatibility with the systems using symlinks in /dev like Solaris. Furthermore, some systems like Linux allow to hardlink a symlink, while the POSIX.1-2001 standard requires that the symlink is followed. Depending on the write permissions and the delivery agent being used, this can lead to an arbitrary local file overwriting vulnerability (CVE-2008-2936). Furthermore, the Postfix delivery agent does not properly verify the ownership of a mailbox before delivering mail (CVE-2008-2937).
CVE-2008-2936.extra: The combination of these features allows a local attacker to hardlink a root-owned symlink such that the newly created symlink would be root-owned and would point to a regular file (or another symlink) that would be written by the Postfix built-in local(8) or virtual(8) delivery agents, regardless the ownership of the final destination regular file. Depending on the write permissions of the spool mail directory, the delivery style, and the existence of a root mailbox, this could allow a local attacker to append a mail to an arbitrary file like /etc/passwd in order to gain root privileges.

CVE-2008-2937.title: Postfix: Local privilege escalation vulnerability — GLSA 200808-12
CVE-2008-2937.subTitle: Postfix incorrectly checks the ownership of a mailbox, allowing, in certain circumstances, to append data to arbitrary files on a local system with root privileges.
CVE-2008-2937.background: Postfix is Wietse Venema's mailer that attempts to be fast, easy to administer, and secure, as an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.
CVE-2008-2937.body: Sebastian Krahmer of SuSE has found that Postfix allows to deliver mail to root-owned symlinks in an insecure manner under certain conditions. Normally, Postfix does not deliver mail to symlinks, except to root-owned symlinks, for compatibility with the systems using symlinks in /dev like Solaris. Furthermore, some systems like Linux allow to hardlink a symlink, while the POSIX.1-2001 standard requires that the symlink is followed. Depending on the write permissions and the delivery agent being used, this can lead to an arbitrary local file overwriting vulnerability (CVE-2008-2936). Furthermore, the Postfix delivery agent does not properly verify the ownership of a mailbox before delivering mail (CVE-2008-2937).
CVE-2008-2937.extra: The combination of these features allows a local attacker to hardlink a root-owned symlink such that the newly created symlink would be root-owned and would point to a regular file (or another symlink) that would be written by the Postfix built-in local(8) or virtual(8) delivery agents, regardless the ownership of the final destination regular file. Depending on the write permissions of the spool mail directory, the delivery style, and the existence of a root mailbox, this could allow a local attacker to append a mail to an arbitrary file like /etc/passwd in order to gain root privileges.

CVE-2008-2942.title: Mercurial: Directory traversal — GLSA 200807-09
CVE-2008-2942.subTitle: A directory traversal vulnerability in Mercurial allows for the renaming of arbitrary files.
CVE-2008-2942.background: Mercurial is a distributed Source Control Management system.
CVE-2008-2942.body: Jakub Wilk discovered a directory traversal vulnerabilty in the applydiff() function in the mercurial/patch.py file.
CVE-2008-2942.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to import a specially crafted patch, possibly resulting in the renaming of arbitrary files, even outside the repository.

CVE-2008-2950.title: Poppler: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200807-04
CVE-2008-2950.subTitle: Poppler is affected by a memory management issue, which could lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-2950.background: Poppler is a cross-platform PDF rendering library originally based on Xpdf.
CVE-2008-2950.body: Felipe Andres Manzano reported a memory management issue in the Page class constructor/destructor.
CVE-2008-2950.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted PDF file with a Poppler-based PDF viewer such as Gentoo's Xpdf, Epdfview, or Evince, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-2952.title: OpenLDAP: Denial of Service vulnerability — GLSA 200808-09
CVE-2008-2952.subTitle: A flaw in OpenLDAP allows remote unauthenticated attackers to cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-2952.background: OpenLDAP Software is an open source implementation of the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol.
CVE-2008-2952.body: Cameron Hotchkies discovered an error within the parsing of ASN.1 BER encoded packets in the "ber_get_next()" function in libraries/liblber/io.c.
CVE-2008-2952.extra: A remote unauthenticated attacker can send a specially crafted ASN.1 BER encoded packet which will trigger the error and cause an "assert()", terminating the "slapd" daemon.

CVE-2008-3103.title: Sun JDK/JRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200911-02
CVE-2008-3103.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Sun JDK and JRE allow for several attacks, including the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-3103.background: The Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) and the Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) provide the Sun Java platform.
CVE-2008-3103.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the Sun Java implementation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below and the associated Sun Alerts for details.
CVE-2008-3103.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JAR archive, applet, or Java Web Start application, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Furthermore, a remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service affecting multiple services via several vectors, disclose information and memory contents, write or execute local files, conduct session hijacking attacks via GIFAR files, steal cookies, bypass the same-origin policy, load untrusted JAR files, establish network connections to arbitrary hosts and posts via several vectors, modify the list of supported graphics configurations, bypass HMAC-based authentication systems, escalate privileges via several vectors and cause applet code to be executed with older, possibly vulnerable versions of the JRE.

CVE-2008-3137.title: Wireshark: Denial of service — GLSA 200808-04
CVE-2008-3137.subTitle: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark.
CVE-2008-3137.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2008-3137.body: Multiple vulnerabilities related to memory management were discovered in the GSM SMS dissector (CVE-2008-3137), the PANA and KISMET dissectors (CVE-2008-3138), the RTMPT dissector (CVE-2008-3139), the syslog dissector (CVE-2008-3140) and the RMI dissector (CVE-2008-3141) and when reassembling fragmented packets (CVE-2008-3145).
CVE-2008-3137.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending a specially crafted packet on a network being monitored by Wireshark or enticing a user to read a malformed packet trace file, causing a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3142.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Python may allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-3142.background: Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.
CVE-2008-3142.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Python:
CVE-2008-3142.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities in Python applications or daemons that pass user-controlled input to vulnerable functions. Exploitation might lead to the execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service. Vulnerabilities within the hashlib might lead to weakened cryptographic protection of data integrity or authenticity.

CVE-2008-3162.title: FFmpeg: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-33
CVE-2008-3162.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in FFmpeg may lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3162.background: FFmpeg is a complete solution to record, convert and stream audio and video. gst-plugins-ffmpeg is a FFmpeg based gstreamer plugin which includes a vulnerable copy of FFmpeg code. Mplayer is a multimedia player which also includes a vulnerable copy of the code.
CVE-2008-3162.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in FFmpeg:
CVE-2008-3162.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted media file, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3215.title: ClamAV: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200808-07
CVE-2008-3215.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3215.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-3215.body: Damian Put has discovered an out-of-bounds memory access while processing Petite files (CVE-2008-2713, CVE-2008-3215). Also, please note that the 0.93 ClamAV branch fixes the first of the two attack vectors of CVE-2007-6595 concerning an insecure creation of temporary files vulnerability. The sigtool attack vector seems still unfixed.
CVE-2008-3215.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted Petite file, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash). Also, the insecure creation of temporary files vulnerability can be triggered by a local user to perform a symlink attack.

CVE-2008-3263.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-3263.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-3263.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.
CVE-2008-3263.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IAX2 channel driver when performing the 3-way handshake (CVE-2008-1897), when handling a large number of POKE requests (CVE-2008-3263), when handling authentication attempts (CVE-2008-5558) and when handling firmware download (FWDOWNL) requests (CVE-2008-3264). Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).
CVE-2008-3263.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service via a daemon crash, call-number exhaustion, CPU or traffic consumption. Remote unauthenticated attackers could furthermore enumerate valid usernames to facilitate brute force login attempts.

CVE-2008-3264.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-3264.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-3264.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.

Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).

CVE-2008-3281.title: libxml2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-06
CVE-2008-3281.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libxml2 might lead to execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3281.background: libxml2 is the XML (eXtended Markup Language) C parser and toolkit initially developed for the Gnome project.
CVE-2008-3281.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in libxml2:
CVE-2008-3281.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to open a specially crafted XML document with an application using libxml2, possibly resulting in the exeution of arbitrary code or a high CPU and memory consumption.

CVE-2008-3337.title: PowerDNS: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-19
CVE-2008-3337.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities have been discovered in PowerDNS, possibly leading to a Denial of Service and easing cache poisoning attacks.
CVE-2008-3337.background: The PowerDNS Nameserver is an authoritative-only nameserver which uses a flexible backend architecture.
CVE-2008-3337.body: Daniel Drown reported an error when receiving a HINFO CH query (CVE-2008-5277). Brian J. Dowling of Simplicity Communications discovered a previously unknown security implication of the PowerDNS behavior to not respond to certain queries it considers malformed (CVE-2008-3337).
CVE-2008-3337.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted queries to cause a Denial of Service. The second vulnerability in itself does not pose a security risk to PowerDNS Nameserver. However, not answering a query for an invalid DNS record within a valid domain allows for a larger spoofing window on third-party nameservers for domains being hosted by PowerDNS Nameserver itself.

CVE-2008-3520.title: JasPer: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-18
CVE-2008-3520.subTitle: Multiple memory management errors in JasPer might lead to execution of arbitrary code via jpeg2k files.
CVE-2008-3520.background: The JasPer Project is an open-source initiative to provide a free software-based reference implementation of the codec specified in the JPEG-2000 Part-1 (jpeg2k) standard.
CVE-2008-3520.body: Marc Espie and Christian Weisgerber have discovered multiple vulnerabilities in JasPer:
CVE-2008-3520.extra: Remote attackers could entice a user or automated system to process specially crafted jpeg2k files with an application using JasPer, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-3529.title: libxml2: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-06
CVE-2008-3529.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in libxml2 might lead to execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3529.background: libxml2 is the XML (eXtended Markup Language) C parser and toolkit initially developed for the Gnome project.
CVE-2008-3529.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were reported in libxml2:
CVE-2008-3529.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to open a specially crafted XML document with an application using libxml2, possibly resulting in the exeution of arbitrary code or a high CPU and memory consumption.

CVE-2008-3546.title: Git: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200809-16
CVE-2008-3546.subTitle: Multiple buffer overflow vulnerabilities have been discovered in Git.
CVE-2008-3546.background: Git is a distributed version control system.
CVE-2008-3546.body: Multiple boundary errors in the functions diff_addremove() and diff_change() when processing overly long repository path names were reported.
CVE-2008-3546.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to run commands like "git-diff" or "git-grep" on a specially crafted repository, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-3547.title: OpenTTD: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200903-09
CVE-2008-3547.subTitle: Multiple buffer overflows in OpenTTD might allow for the execution of arbitrary code in the server.
CVE-2008-3547.background: OpenTTD is a clone of Transport Tycoon Deluxe.
CVE-2008-3547.body: Multiple buffer overflows have been reported in OpenTTD, when storing long for client names (CVE-2008-3547), in the TruncateString function in src/gfx.cpp (CVE-2008-3576) and in src/openttd.cpp when processing a large filename supplied to the "-g" parameter in the ttd_main function (CVE-2008-3577).
CVE-2008-3547.extra: An authenticated attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the OpenTTD server.

CVE-2008-3680.title: Ventrilo: Denial of service — GLSA 200904-13
CVE-2008-3680.subTitle: A vulnerability has been discovered in Ventrilo, allowing for a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3680.background: Ventrilo is a Voice over IP group communication server.
CVE-2008-3680.body: Luigi Auriemma reported a NULL pointer dereference in Ventrilo when processing packets with an invalid version number followed by another packet.

CVE-2008-3863.title: enscript: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-02
CVE-2008-3863.subTitle: Two buffer overflows in enscript might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-3863.background: enscript is a powerful ASCII to PostScript file converter.
CVE-2008-3863.body: Two stack-based buffer overflows in the read_special_escape() function in src/psgen.c have been reported. Ulf Harnhammar of Secunia Research discovered a vulnerability related to the "setfilename" command (CVE-2008-3863), and Kees Cook of Ubuntu discovered a vulnerability related to the "font" escape sequence (CVE-2008-4306).
CVE-2008-3863.extra: An attacker could entice a user or automated system to process specially crafted input with the special escapes processing enabled using the "-e" option, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-3889.title: Postfix: Denial of service — GLSA 200809-09
CVE-2008-3889.subTitle: A memory leak in Postfix might allow local users to cause a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3889.background: Postfix is Wietse Venema's mailer that attempts to be fast, easy to administer, and secure, as an alternative to the widely-used Sendmail program.
CVE-2008-3889.body: It has been discovered than Postfix leaks an epoll file descriptor when executing external commands, e.g. user-controlled $HOME/.forward or $HOME/.procmailrc files. NOTE: This vulnerability only concerns Postfix instances running on Linux 2.6 kernels.
CVE-2008-3889.extra: A local attacker could exploit this vulnerability to reduce the performance of Postfix, and possibly trigger an assertion, resulting in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3903.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-3903.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-3903.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.
CVE-2008-3903.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IAX2 channel driver when performing the 3-way handshake (CVE-2008-1897), when handling a large number of POKE requests (CVE-2008-3263), when handling authentication attempts (CVE-2008-5558) and when handling firmware download (FWDOWNL) requests (CVE-2008-3264). Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).
CVE-2008-3903.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service via a daemon crash, call-number exhaustion, CPU or traffic consumption. Remote unauthenticated attackers could furthermore enumerate valid usernames to facilitate brute force login attempts.

CVE-2008-3907.title: Newsbeuter: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200809-12
CVE-2008-3907.subTitle: Insufficient input validation in newsbeuter may allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary shell commands.
CVE-2008-3907.background: Newsbeuter is a RSS/Atom feed reader for the text console.
CVE-2008-3907.body: J.H.M. Dassen reported that the open-in-browser command does not properly escape shell metacharacters in the URL before passing it to system().
CVE-2008-3907.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a feed with specially crafted URLs, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary shell commands with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-3912.title: ClamAV: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200809-18
CVE-2008-3912.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3912.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-3912.body: Hanno boeck reported an error in libclamav/chmunpack.c when processing CHM files (CVE-2008-1389). Other unspecified vulnerabilities were also reported, including a NULL pointer dereference in libclamav (CVE-2008-3912), memory leaks in freshclam/manager.c (CVE-2008-3913), and file descriptor leaks in libclamav/others.c and libclamav/sis.c (CVE-2008-3914).
CVE-2008-3912.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted CHM, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash). The other attack vectors mentioned above could also result in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3914.title: ClamAV: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200809-18
CVE-2008-3914.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in ClamAV may result in a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-3914.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-3914.body: Hanno boeck reported an error in libclamav/chmunpack.c when processing CHM files (CVE-2008-1389). Other unspecified vulnerabilities were also reported, including a NULL pointer dereference in libclamav (CVE-2008-3912), memory leaks in freshclam/manager.c (CVE-2008-3913), and file descriptor leaks in libclamav/others.c and libclamav/sis.c (CVE-2008-3914).
CVE-2008-3914.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted CHM, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service (daemon crash). The other attack vectors mentioned above could also result in a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3916.title: GNU ed: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200809-15
CVE-2008-3916.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability in ed may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-3916.background: GNU ed is a basic line editor. red is a restricted version of ed that does not allow shell command execution.
CVE-2008-3916.body: Alfredo Ortega from Core Security Technologies reported a heap-based buffer overflow in the strip_escapes() function when processing overly long filenames.
CVE-2008-3916.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process specially crafted commands with ed or red, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-3920.title: BitlBee: Security bypass — GLSA 200809-14
CVE-2008-3920.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Bitlbee may allow to bypass security restrictions and hijack accounts.
CVE-2008-3920.background: BitlBee is an IRC to IM gateway that support multiple IM protocols.
CVE-2008-3920.body: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities were reported, including a NULL pointer dereference.
CVE-2008-3920.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to overwrite existing IM accounts.

CVE-2008-3932.title: Wireshark: Multiple Denials of Service — GLSA 200809-17
CVE-2008-3932.subTitle: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities have been discovered in Wireshark.
CVE-2008-3932.background: Wireshark is a network protocol analyzer with a graphical front-end.
CVE-2008-3932.extra: A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities by sending specially crafted packets on a network being monitored by Wireshark or by enticing a user to read a malformed packet trace file, causing a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-3949.title: GNU Emacs, XEmacs: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200902-06
CVE-2008-3949.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities were found in GNU Emacs, possibly leading to user-assisted execution of arbitrary code. One also affects edit-utils in XEmacs.
CVE-2008-3949.background: GNU Emacs and XEmacs are highly extensible and customizable text editors. edit-utils are miscellaneous extensions to XEmacs.
CVE-2008-3949.body: Morten Welinder reports about GNU Emacs and edit-utils in XEmacs: By shipping a .flc accompanying a source file (.c for example) and setting font-lock-support-mode to fast-lock-mode in the source file through local variables, any Lisp code in the .flc file is executed without warning (CVE-2008-2142).
CVE-2008-3949.extra: Romain Francoise reported a security risk in a feature of GNU Emacs related to interacting with Python. The vulnerability arises because Python, by default, prepends the current directory to the module search path, allowing for arbitrary code execution when launched from a specially crafted directory (CVE-2008-3949).

CVE-2008-3964.title: POV-Ray: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-15
CVE-2008-3964.subTitle: POV-Ray includes a version of libpng that might allow for the execution of arbitrary code when reading a specially crafted PNG file
CVE-2008-3964.background: POV-Ray is a well known open-source ray tracer.
CVE-2008-3964.body: POV-Ray uses a statically linked copy of libpng to view and output PNG files. The version shipped with POV-Ray is vulnerable to CVE-2008-3964, CVE-2008-1382, CVE-2006-3334, CVE-2006-0481, CVE-2004-0768. A bug in POV-Ray's build system caused it to load the old version when your installed copy of libpng was >=media-libs/libpng-1.2.10.
CVE-2008-3964.extra: An attacker could entice a user to load a specially crafted PNG file as a texture, resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-4096.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in phpMyAdmin:
CVE-2008-4096.extra: A remote attacker may execute arbitrary code with the rights of the webserver, inject and execute SQL with the rights of phpMyAdmin or conduct XSS attacks against other users.

CVE-2008-4201.title: FAAD2: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200811-03
CVE-2008-4201.subTitle: A buffer overflow in FAAD2 might lead to user-assisted execution of arbitrary code via an MP4 file.
CVE-2008-4201.background: FAAD2 is an open source MPEG-4 and MPEG-2 AAC decoder.

CVE-2008-4201.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted MPEG-4 (MP4) file in an application using FAAD2, possibly leading to the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-4303.title: phpCollab: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-20
CVE-2008-4303.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in phpCollab allowing for remote injection of shell commands, PHP code and SQL statements.
CVE-2008-4303.background: phpCollab is a web-enabled groupware and project management software written in PHP. It uses SQL-based database backends.
CVE-2008-4303.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in phpCollab:
CVE-2008-4303.extra: These vulnerabilities enable remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL statements and PHP code. NOTE: Some of the SQL injection vulnerabilities require the php.ini option "magic_quotes_gpc" to be disabled. Furthermore, an attacker might be able to execute arbitrary shell commands if "register_globals" is enabled, "magic_quotes_gpc" is disabled, the PHP OpenSSL extension is not installed or loaded and the file "installation/setup.php" has not been deleted after installation.

CVE-2008-4306.subTitle: Two buffer overflows in enscript might lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-4306.background: enscript is a powerful ASCII to PostScript file converter.
CVE-2008-4306.body: Two stack-based buffer overflows in the read_special_escape() function in src/psgen.c have been reported. Ulf Harnhammar of Secunia Research discovered a vulnerability related to the "setfilename" command (CVE-2008-3863), and Kees Cook of Ubuntu discovered a vulnerability related to the "font" escape sequence (CVE-2008-4306).
CVE-2008-4306.extra: An attacker could entice a user or automated system to process specially crafted input with the special escapes processing enabled using the "-e" option, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

CVE-2008-4309.body: Oscar Mira-Sanchez reported an integer overflow in the netsnmp_create_subtree_cache() function in agent/snmp_agent.c when processing GETBULK requests.
CVE-2008-4309.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted request to crash the SNMP server. NOTE: The attacker needs to know the community string to exploit this vulnerability.

CVE-2008-4401.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted SWF file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user or a Denial of Service (crash). CVE-2008-5032.background: VLC is a cross-platform media player and streaming server.
CVE-2008-5032.body: Tobias Klein reported the following vulnerabilities:
CVE-2008-5032.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted CUE image file, RealMedia file or RealText subtitle file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

CVE-2008-5050.title: ClamAV: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200812-21
CVE-2008-5050.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities in ClamAV may allow for the remote execution of arbitrary code or a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-5050.background: Clam AntiVirus is a free anti-virus toolkit for UNIX, designed especially for e-mail scanning on mail gateways.
CVE-2008-5050.body: Moritz Jodeit reported an off-by-one error within the get_unicode_name() function in libclamav/vba_extract.c when processing VBA project files (CVE-2008-5050). Ilja van Sprundel reported an infinite recursion error within the cli_check_jpeg_exploit() function in libclamav/special.c when processing JPEG files (CVE-2008-5314).
CVE-2008-5050.extra: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted VBA or JPEG file to the clamd daemon, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-5077.title: OpenSSL: Certificate validation error — GLSA 200902-02
CVE-2008-5077.subTitle: An error in the OpenSSL certificate chain validation might allow for spoofing attacks.
CVE-2008-5077.background: OpenSSL is an Open Source toolkit implementing the Secure Sockets Layer (SSL v2/v3) and Transport Layer Security (TLS v1) as well as a general purpose cryptography library.
CVE-2008-5077.body: The Google Security Team reported that several functions incorrectly check the result after calling the EVP_VerifyFinal() function, allowing a malformed signature to be treated as a good signature rather than as an error. This issue affects the signature checks on DSA and ECDSA keys used with SSL/TLS.
CVE-2008-5077.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability and spoof arbitrary names to conduct Man-In-The-Middle attacks and intercept sensitive information.

CVE-2008-5081.title: Avahi: Denial of service — GLSA 200901-11
CVE-2008-5081.subTitle: A Denial of Service vulnerability has been discovered in Avahi.
CVE-2008-5081.background: Avahi is a system that facilitates service discovery on a local network.
CVE-2008-5081.body: Hugo Dias reported a failed assertion in the originates_from_local_legacy_unicast_socket() function in avahi-core/server.c when processing mDNS packets with a source port of 0.
CVE-2008-5081.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted packets to the daemon, leading to its crash.

CVE-2008-5101.title: OptiPNG: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-01
CVE-2008-5101.subTitle: A vulnerability in OptiPNG might result in user-assisted execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-5101.background: OptiPNG is a PNG optimizer that recompresses image files to a smaller size, without losing any information.
CVE-2008-5101.body: A buffer overflow in the BMP reader in OptiPNG has been reported.
CVE-2008-5101.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted BMP image, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-5178.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-30
CVE-2008-5178.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Opera, the worst of which allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-5178.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-5178.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Opera:
CVE-2008-5178.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JPEG image to cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code, to process an overly long file:// URL or to open a specially crafted web page to execute arbitrary code. He could also read existing subscriptions and force subscriptions to arbitrary feed URLs, as well as inject arbitrary web script or HTML via built-in XSLT templates.

CVE-2008-5187.title: Imlib2: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200812-23
CVE-2008-5187.subTitle: A buffer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in Imlib2.
CVE-2008-5187.background: Imlib2 is replacement library from the Enlightenment project for libraries like libXpm.
CVE-2008-5187.body: Julien Danjou reported a pointer arithmetic error and a heap-based buffer overflow within the load() function of the XPM image loader.
CVE-2008-5187.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to process a specially crafted XPM image, possibly resulting in the remote execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application, or a Denial of Service.

CVE-2008-5297.title: noip-updater: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200901-12
CVE-2008-5297.subTitle: A buffer overflow in noip-updater can lead to arbitrary code execution.
CVE-2008-5297.background: noip-updater is a tool used for updating IP addresses of dynamic DNS records at no-ip.com.
CVE-2008-5297.body: xenomuta found out that the GetNextLine() function in noip2.c misses a length check, leading to a stack-based buffer overflow.
CVE-2008-5297.extra: A remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code by sending a specially crafted HTTP message to the client. NOTE: Successful exploitation requires a man in the middle attack, a DNS spoofing attack or a compromise of no-ip.com servers.

CVE-2008-5340.title: Sun JDK/JRE: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200911-02
CVE-2008-5340.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in the Sun JDK and JRE allow for several attacks, including the remote execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-5340.background: The Sun Java Development Kit (JDK) and the Sun Java Runtime Environment (JRE) provide the Sun Java platform.
CVE-2008-5340.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in the Sun Java implementation. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below and the associated Sun Alerts for details.
CVE-2008-5340.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JAR archive, applet, or Java Web Start application, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application. Furthermore, a remote attacker could cause a Denial of Service affecting multiple services via several vectors, disclose information and memory contents, write or execute local files, conduct session hijacking attacks via GIFAR files, steal cookies, bypass the same-origin policy, load untrusted JAR files, establish network connections to arbitrary hosts and posts via several vectors, modify the list of supported graphics configurations, bypass HMAC-based authentication systems, escalate privileges via several vectors and cause applet code to be executed with older, possibly vulnerable versions of the JRE.

CVE-2008-5361.title: Adobe Flash Player: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-23
CVE-2008-5361.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been identified, the worst of which allow arbitrary code execution on a user's system via a malicious Flash file.
CVE-2008-5361.background: The Adobe Flash Player is a renderer for the popular SWF file format, which is commonly used to provide interactive websites, digital experiences and mobile content.
CVE-2008-5361.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in Adobe Flash Player:
CVE-2008-5361.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted SWF file, possibly resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user or a Denial of Service (crash). Furthermore a remote attacker could gain access to sensitive information, disclose memory contents by enticing a user to open a specially crafted PDF file inside a Flash application, modify the victim's clipboard or render it temporarily unusable, persuade a user into uploading or downloading files, bypass security restrictions with the assistance of the user to gain access to camera and microphone, conduct Cross-Site Scripting and HTTP Header Splitting attacks, bypass the "non-root domain policy" of Flash, and gain escalated privileges.

CVE-2008-5397.title: Tor: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200904-11
CVE-2008-5397.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Tor might allow for heap corruption, Denial of Service, escalation of privileges and information disclosure.
CVE-2008-5397.background: Tor is an implementation of second generation Onion Routing, a connection-oriented anonymizing communication service.
CVE-2008-5397.body: A local attacker could escalate privileges by leveraging unintended supplementary group memberships of the Tor process. A remote attacker could exploit these vulnerabilities to cause a heap corruption with unknown impact and attack vectors, to cause a Denial of Service via CPU consuption or daemon crash, and to weaken anonymity provided by the service.
CVE-2008-5397.extra: There is no known workaround at this time.

CVE-2008-5558.title: Asterisk: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200905-01
CVE-2008-5558.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Asterisk allowing for Denial of Service and username disclosure.
CVE-2008-5558.background: Asterisk is an open source telephony engine and toolkit.
CVE-2008-5558.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in the IAX2 channel driver when performing the 3-way handshake (CVE-2008-1897), when handling a large number of POKE requests (CVE-2008-3263), when handling authentication attempts (CVE-2008-5558) and when handling firmware download (FWDOWNL) requests (CVE-2008-3264). Asterisk does also not correctly handle SIP INVITE messages that lack a "From" header (CVE-2008-2119), and responds differently to a failed login attempt depending on whether the user account exists (CVE-2008-3903, CVE-2009-0041).
CVE-2008-5558.extra: Remote unauthenticated attackers could send specially crafted data to Asterisk, possibly resulting in a Denial of Service via a daemon crash, call-number exhaustion, CPU or traffic consumption. Remote unauthenticated attackers could furthermore enumerate valid usernames to facilitate brute force login attempts.

CVE-2008-5621.title: phpMyAdmin: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-32
CVE-2008-5621.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in phpMyAdmin, the worst of which may allow for remote code execution.
CVE-2008-5621.background: phpMyAdmin is a web-based management tool for MySQL databases.
CVE-2008-5621.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in phpMyAdmin:
CVE-2008-5621.extra: A remote attacker may execute arbitrary code with the rights of the webserver, inject and execute SQL with the rights of phpMyAdmin or conduct XSS attacks against other users.

CVE-2008-5679.title: Opera: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-30
CVE-2008-5679.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in Opera, the worst of which allow for the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-5679.background: Opera is a fast web browser that is available free of charge.
CVE-2008-5679.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in Opera:
CVE-2008-5679.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted JPEG image to cause a Denial of Service or execute arbitrary code, to process an overly long file:// URL or to open a specially crafted web page to execute arbitrary code. He could also read existing subscriptions and force subscriptions to arbitrary feed URLs, as well as inject arbitrary web script or HTML via built-in XSLT templates.

CVE-2008-5747.title: F-PROT Antivirus: Multiple Denial of Service vulnerabilities — GLSA 200904-14
CVE-2008-5747.subTitle: Multiple errors in F-PROT Antivirus may lead to a Denial of Service.
CVE-2008-5747.background: F-PROT Antivirus is a multi-platform virus scanner for workstations and mail servers.
CVE-2008-5747.extra: A remote attacker could entice a user or automated system to scan a specially crafted file, leading to a crash or infinite loop.

CVE-2008-5905.title: KTorrent: Multiple vulnerabilitites — GLSA 200902-05
CVE-2008-5905.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities in the web interface plugin in KTorrent allow for remote execution of code and arbitrary torrent uploads.
CVE-2008-5905.background: KTorrent is a BitTorrent program for KDE.
CVE-2008-5905.body: The web interface plugin does not restrict access to the torrent upload functionality (CVE-2008-5905) and does not sanitize request parameters properly (CVE-2008-5906) .
CVE-2008-5905.extra: A remote attacker could send specially crafted parameters to the web interface that would allow for arbitrary torrent uploads and remote code execution with the privileges of the KTorrent process.

CVE-2008-5906.title: KTorrent: Multiple vulnerabilitites — GLSA 200902-05
CVE-2008-5906.subTitle: Two vulnerabilities in the web interface plugin in KTorrent allow for remote execution of code and arbitrary torrent uploads.

CVE-2008-6218.title: libpng: Multiple vulnerabilities — GLSA 200903-28
CVE-2008-6218.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities were found in libpng, which might result in the execution of arbitrary code
CVE-2008-6218.background: libpng is the official PNG reference library used to read, write and manipulate PNG images.
CVE-2008-6218.body: Multiple vulnerabilities were discovered in libpng:
CVE-2008-6218.extra: A remote attacker may execute arbitrary code with the privileges of the user opening a specially crafted PNG file by exploiting the erroneous out-of-memory handling. An attacker may also exploit the png_check_keyword() error to set arbitrary memory locations to 0, if the application allows overlong, user-controlled keywords when writing PNG files. The png_handle_tEXT() vulnerability may be exploited by an attacker to potentially consume all memory on a users system when a specially crafted PNG file is opened.

CVE-2008-6373.title: Nagios: Execution of arbitrary code — GLSA 200907-15
CVE-2008-6373.subTitle: Multiple vulnerabilities in Nagios may lead to the execution of arbitrary code.
CVE-2008-6373.background: Nagios is an open source host, service and network monitoring program.
CVE-2008-6373.body: Multiple vulnerabilities have been reported in Nagios:
CVE-2008-6373.extra: A remote authenticated or unauthenticated attacker may exploit these vulnerabilities to execute arbitrary commands or elevate privileges.
